lessons.japanese: その番組はだんだんおもしろくなってきた。
lessons.english: The television serial is getting more and more interesting.

lessons.japanese: その仕事はあまりおもしろくなかったが、他方で報酬が良かった。
lessons.english: That job was not very interesting, but on the other hand it was well paid.

lessons.japanese: その映画は原作ほどおもしろくなかった。
lessons.english: The movie was less funny than the book.

lessons.japanese: その映画は原作ほどおもしろくない。
lessons.english: The movie is not so interesting as the original.

lessons.japanese: この本は全然おもしろくない。
lessons.english: This book isn't interesting at all.

lessons.japanese: この本はあの本ほどおもしろくない。
lessons.english: This book isn't as interesting as that book.

lessons.japanese: こういうタイプの人はおもしろくない。
lessons.english: That type of person is dull.

lessons.japanese: 率直に言って、彼の新しい小説はあまりおもしろくない。
lessons.english: Frankly speaking, his new novel is not very interesting.

lessons.japanese: 麻薬に手を出すとろくなことはない。
lessons.english: If you mess with drugs, you're asking for trouble.

lessons.japanese: 彼にはこの単調な家庭生活がおもしろくなかった。
lessons.english: He did not relish this simple family life.

lessons.japanese: 実をいうと、あの映画は私にはあまりおもしろくなかった。
lessons.english: To tell the truth, that film was not very interesting to me.
